result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Wienke, Robert L

records.addlTxt:
3:43 PM Defendant Robert L Wienke appeared by video from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by video for Robert L Wienke.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Zamzow states that the matter is resolved; requests a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing by video
bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert L Wienke
Current: PO Box 661, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0061 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 242 W. 4th Street Apt 6, Westfield, WI 53964

4:06 PM Defendant Robert L Wienke not in court.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by zoom for Robert L Wienke.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Zamzow states that her client has been sent to the Wisconsin State Prison System and has not spoke with him about the offer that was received this morning.

BY THE COURT:  Set another status
Counsel to coordinate with the JA to set up zoom
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert L Wienke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by video for Robert L Wienke. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Atty Zamzow waives time limits.  Court questions defendant.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds time limits waived.  Bond continued.  Set for status.
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert L Wienke appeared by video, in custody. 
Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant did call the PD office but they need more info on his vehicle which he can't get.

BY THE COURT:  Reset one more week.
bond continued
Initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No contact with or going on the premises of the Pioneer Mobil Gas Station in Westfield, WI

3:42 PM Defendant Robert L Wienke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Annie Getsinger appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $10,000 cash bond with condition.  Atty Juech states that in speaking with the defendant's Agent, he is on a hold.  
Atty Getsinger asks for a breakout room.  
BACK ON THE RECORD:  Atty Getsinger makes bail arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $10,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No contact with or going on the premises of the Pioneer Mobil Gas Station in Westfield, WI
Initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
